## Natural history notes

The Swift Crab Spider (Mecaphesa celer), like most crab spiders in the Thomisidae family, have long front 2 pairs of legs and short back two pairs of legs. Males are often darker than females with red bands on their legs. Males are also half the size of female Swift Crab Spiders. Females may display sexual cannibalism, eating their male mates.
